title: 2021 OFC Champions League
text:
The 2021 OFC Champions League was originally to be the 20th edition of the Oceanian Club Championship, <a href="Oceania">Oceania</a>'s premier club <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organized by the <a href="Oceania%20Football%20Confederation">Oceania Football Confederation</a> (OFC), and the 15th season under the current <a href="OFC%20Champions%20League">OFC Champions League</a> name.
The tournament, which would usually be played in the first half of the year, were originally postponed to start no earlier than 1 July due to border closures throughout the Pacific caused by the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. On 4 June 2021, the OFC announced that the tournament had been cancelled, and no champions would be awarded for the second season in a row. The OFC representative at the <a href="2021%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">2021 FIFA Club World Cup</a> in <a href="Japan">Japan</a>, which would originally be the winners of the 2021 OFC Champions League, was confirmed to be <a href="Auckland%20City%20FC">Auckland City</a> on 3 August 2021 following a decision by the OFC Executive Committee, based on sporting merit principles which took into consideration the final placing of every member association's national league champion and runner-up in each OFC Champions League between 2016 and 2020, with the results combined to determine an overall ranking, and applied to the clubs nominated by their member association as the champion or runner-up from their respective national leagues to qualify for the 2021 OFC Champions League.
<a href="Hiengh%C3%A8ne%20Sport">Hienghène Sport</a>, having won the title in <a href="2019%20OFC%20Champions%20League">2019</a>, were the title holders, since the <a href="2020%20OFC%20Champions%20League">2020 edition</a> was cancelled due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a> and the title was not awarded. However, they failed to qualify for the tournament.
Teams.
A total of 18 teams from all 11 <a href="Oceania%20Football%20Confederation">OFC</a> member associations were eligible to enter the competition.
Schedule.
The tournament would originally be played between January and May 2021, with the qualifying stage scheduled to be played in <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a> in January, and the group stage starting in February. However, the OFC announced on 5 November 2020 that the tournament would begin no earlier than 1 July due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. On 4 March 2021, the OFC announced that the tournament would be played before 31 October 2021, and one option was to hold a single, centralised tournament in <a href="Fiji">Fiji</a> in October. However, the tournament was eventually cancelled after a number of options were explored due to border closures throughout the Pacific.
